terms.description: HyperText Markup Language, the standard markup language for creating web pages.
Cascading Style Sheets, used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in HTML.
A programming language that enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications.
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single page applications.
A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine, used for building scalable network applications.
A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.
A source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program.
Structured Query Language, used for managing and manipulating relational databases.
Application Programming Interface, a set of protocols and tools for building software applications.
A distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.
A set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.
Amazon Web Services, a subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs.
Representational State Transfer, an architectural style for designing networked applications.
A query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries with your existing data.
A strict syntactical superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing to the language.
